summary: This is an email from May 2020 in which a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) official is coordinating the collection of documents and information from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York related to the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The email lists 20 specific categories of records being sought for litigation, including logs, reports, video footage, and correspondence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the document; the email is about gathering all MCC records related to his incarceration and death.

persons.name: Proto
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to a phone call annotation in an Intake Screening log book dated July 30, 2019.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The individual to whom the Intake Screening log book was to be turned over.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: A psychologist who forwarded psychological information to the Associate Warden.

connections.description: Proto made a phone call annotation related to Epstein in an MCC log book on July 30, 2019.

events.title: Phone Call Annotation by Proto
events.description: An annotation for a phone call made by MCC staff member Proto is noted in the Intake Screening log book.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: The document references the incident and subsequent suicide reconstruction, indicating the context is the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

events.title: BOP Document Collection Request
events.description: A BOP official sends an email requesting the urgent collection of 20 categories of MCC documents related to Jeffrey Epstein for ongoing litigation.

locations: MCC New York, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The FBI had taken control of all physical log books from the time of Epstein's incident and suicide reconstruction.
The BOP was actively engaged in litigation regarding documents and information in MCC records related to Jeffrey Epstein as of May 2020.

The document request includes 20 specific items, ranging from visitor logs and meeting records to video footage and SIS reports, highlighting a comprehensive investigation into the circumstances of Epstein's death.
A specific annotation for a phone call made by staff member 'Proto' on July 30, 2019, is noted in an MCC Intake Screening log book.
